intro: Hieracium pallidum subsp. curcicianum, commonly known as the Curcician hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are basal, lanceolate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. It is a perennial species that spreads through both seeds and rhizomes, making it a common weed in agricultural areas.
